{{cpp/memory/unique_ptr/title|operator&amp;lt;&amp;lt;}}
{{cpp/memory/unique_ptr/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|since=c++20|1=
template&lt; class CharT, class Traits, class Y, class D &gt;
std::basic_ostream&lt;CharT, Traits&gt;&amp; operator&lt;&lt;( std::basic_ostream&lt;CharT, Traits&gt;&amp; os,
                                               const std::unique_ptr&lt;Y, D&gt;&amp; p );
}}
{{dcl end}}

Inserts the value of the pointer managed by {{c|p}} into the output stream {{c|os}}.

Equivalent to {{c|os &lt;&lt; p.get()}}.

{{cpp/enable if|{{c|os &lt;&lt; p.get()}} is a valid expression.}}

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|os|a {{lc|std::basic_ostream}} to insert {{c|p}} into}}
{{par|p|the pointer to be inserted into {{c|os}}}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
{{c|os}}

===Notes===
If {{c|std::unique_ptr&lt;Y, D&gt;::pointer}} is a pointer to a character type (e.g., when {{tt|Y}} is {{c|char}}({{c|[]}}) or {{c|CharT}}({{c|[]}})), this may end up calling the [[cpp/io/basic_ostream/operator_ltlt2|overloads of {{tt|operator&lt;&lt;}} for null-terminated character strings]] (causing undefined behavior if the pointer does not in fact point to such a string), rather than [[cpp/io/basic_ostream/operator_ltlt|the overload for printing the value of the pointer itself]].

===Example===
{{example
|p=true
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;memory&gt;

class Foo {};

int main()
{
    auto p = std::make_unique&lt;Foo&gt;();
    std::cout &lt;&lt; p &lt;&lt; '\n';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; p.get() &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|p=true
|output=
0x6d9028
0x6d9028
}}
